name: add
javadoc:
/**
 * Adds a new object to the collection and increments its count.
 *
 * @param object The object to be added. It must not be null.
 */

name: entrySet
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a set view of the mappings contained in this map.
 *
 * @return a set view of the mappings contained in this map
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a Set view of the mappings contained in this map. The set's iterator returns a collection-style view of the mappings contained in this map, such that additions modifications to the returned set are reflected in the map.
 *
 * @return a Set view of the mappings contained in this map
 */

name: getCount
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the count of the given object from the map.
 *
 * @param object the object to retrieve the count for
 * @return the count of the object in the map
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Retrieves and returns the count of the specified object from the map, 
 * incrementing the count if the object is already present.
 *
 * @param object the object to retrieve the count for
 * @return the current count of the object in the map
 */

name: uniqueElementSize
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the number of unique elements in the map.
 *
 * @return The size of the map, representing the number of unique elements.
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the number of key-value pairs in the map.
 *
 * @return The size of the map, representing the number of entries (key-value pairs).
 */

signature: private int getIntersection(final TinyBag bagA, final TinyBag bagB)
name: getIntersection
javadoc:
/**
 * Calculates the intersection of two TinyBag instances.
 *
 * This method iterates over each entry in the first bag and calculates the minimum count of each element
 * that is present in both bags. The result is the total sum of these minimum counts.
 *
 * @param bagA the first TinyBag instance
 * @param bagB the second TinyBag instance
 * @return the intersection of the two bags, represented as an integer
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Calculates the intersection of two TinyBag instances.
 *
 * This method iterates over each entry in the first bag and calculates the minimum count of each element that is present in both bags.
 * The result is the total sum of these minimum counts, representing the intersection of the two bags.
 *
 * @param bagA the first TinyBag instance
 * @param bagB the second TinyBag instance
 * @return the total sum of the minimum counts of common elements between the two bags
 */

signature: public IntersectionResult apply(final CharSequence left, final CharSequence right)
name: apply
javadoc:
/**
 * Applies this operation to two input sequences.
 *
 * @param left  the first sequence of elements
 * @param right the second sequence of elements
 * @return an IntersectionResult object containing information about the intersection
 * @throws IllegalArgumentException if either input is null
 */

name: toBag
javadoc:
/**
 * Converts a collection of objects into a TinyBag.
 *
 * @param objects the collection to be converted
 * @return a new TinyBag containing all elements from the input collection
 */
improved_javadoc:
/**
 * Converts a collection of objects into a TinyBag, preserving the original order and uniqueness of elements.
 *
 * @param <T> the type of objects in the collection
 * @param objects the collection to be converted (may not be null)
 * @return a new TinyBag containing all unique elements from the input collection, or an empty TinyBag if the input is empty
 */
